author: Byron Tau
title: Remember the Age of Paper Ballots? Itâ€™s Back
text:
In an era rife with concerns about cybersecurity, election officials are increasingly turning to a decidedly low-tech solution: paper.
While security advocates have long considered use of paper a best practice for election integrity, the pace of its adoption has accelerated in the wake of Russian meddling in the U.S. election in 2016. City and county governments around the country and a handful of states, so far, have moved to replace electronic voting methods with paper ballots or to adopt electronic-voting machines that...
